title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: We passed through thedrawing-room, and went on a few yards to theend of a walk whence you see Loch Lee, a wildbut not large lake closed in by mountains, with afarm-house and a few cottages at its edge.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: Aswe approached the Manse of Loch Lee, the glenwidened, and the old Castle of Lnvermark cameout extremely well, and, surrounded by woods andcorn-fields, in which the people were "shearing,"looked most picturesque.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: Aswe approached the Manse of Loch Lee, the glenwidened, and the old Castle of Invermark cameout extremely well ; and, surrounded by woods andcorn-fields, in which the people were " shearing,"looked most picturesque.
